linear.matrix

Interface DataMatrixInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DataMatrix, SymmetricFloatMatrix

    public interface DataMatrixInterface
    This interface declares the methods used on the data matrix object.

    • Method Summary

      • numberOfRows

        int numberOfRows()
        Returns:
        The number of rows in the matrix.

      • numberOfColumns

        int numberOfColumns()
        Returns:
        The number of columns in the matrix.

      • setElementAt

        void setElementAt(int row,
                int column,
                float value)
        Sets the element in the matrix to a specified value.
        Parameters:
        row - Row index.
        column - Column index.
        value - Value to set the element to.

        float getElementAt(int row,
                 int column)
        Parameters:

        column - Column index.
        Returns:

          float[] values)
            throws java.lang.Exception
        Sets the entire row to a specified vector of values.
        Parameters:
        row - Row index.
        values - A float array of values to set the matrix row to.

        java.lang.Exception

             float[] values)

      • getRow

        float[] getRow(int row)
        Parameters:
        row - Row index.
        Returns:
        Row values in a float array.

      • getColumn

        float[] getColumn(int column)
        Parameters:
        column - Column index.
        Returns:
        Column values in a float array.

      • isSquare

        boolean isSquare()
        Returns:
        True if the number of rows equals the number of columns, false otherwise.

      • isSymmetricMatrixImplementation

        boolean isSymmetricMatrixImplementation()
        This method does not in fact check for symmetry in the specific matrix but rather returns an indicator of whether the specific implementation enforces that matrix be symmetric or not. Some of the implementations that do also save space by only holding one copy of m(i,j) and m(j,i).
        Returns:
        True, if for each i,j it holds that m(i,j) = m(j,i).

      • plus

        DataMatrixInterface plus(DataMatrixInterface matrix)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Matrix addition.
        Parameters:
        matrix - Matrix to add to the current matrix.
        Returns:
        Addition result.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

        Returns:

      • multiply

        DataMatrixInterface multiply(DataMatrixInterface matrix)
                             throws java.lang.Exception

        Parameters:

        Multiplication result.
        Throws:

      • multiply

        DataMatrixInterface multiply(float scalar)
        Scalar multiplication.
        Parameters:

        Scalar multiplication result.
